intro: Chlaenobolus spicatus, commonly known as the spicate chlaenobolus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters that give the plant its common name. Chlaenobolus spicatus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
